lead_paragraph: GARDNER--Gene Lipscomb, passed away peacefully at her Vero Beach, Florida home from a full and joyful life on February 7, 2016. She was 85. Beloved wife of Robert C. Gardner and cherished mother of Ann L. Vessalico, Lynn C.G. Stack and William W. Gardner, Gene is also survived by her sister, Ann L. Nolte, three adoring grandchildren, Mark R. Vessalico, Courtney G. Stack and Charlotte L. Stack, and sons-in- law, John Vessalico and Richard Wehrmann. Born on November 24, 1930 in Dallas, Texas to former Pan Amercan World Airways Sr. Vice President Willis G. Lipscomb and Eugenia M. Lipscomb, Gene and her family moved to Plandome, Long Island in 1941. Following graduation from Manhasset High School, she excelled at Randolph- Macon Woman's College, graduating Phi Beta Kappa in 1953. The esteemed Lipscomb Library, named after Gene's uncle, Herbert C. Lipscomb, an inspiring professor and Latin scholar, remains a cornerstone of the college today. Gene and Bob raised their family in Manhasset, New York and later, Locust Valley, New York and now reside in Vero Beach, Florida. Gene's zest for life and deep love of her family and friends touched the lives of many who will carry her in their hearts always. A service celebrating Gene's life will be held at St. John's of Lattingtown in Locust Valley, New York on March 18, 2016 at 11:00am followed by a reception at The Creek. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  GARDNER, GENE LIPSCOMB
